subject: Re: [junit] Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... [To the original questioner, and not to Vladimir] The correct way to solve this problem is to read the JavaDoc that comes with JUnit. Take care. -- J. B.
messageBody:
Vladimir Ritz Bossicard wrote:

> > public static Test suite(){
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> > suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
> > return suite;
> >
> > Its giving the following compile time error :
> >
> > TestLanguageVector.java:25: addTest(junit.framework.Test) in
> > junit.framework.TestSuite cannot be applied to (java.lang.Class)
> > suite.addTest(TestLanguageVector.class);
>
> the correct method to use it 'addTestSuite' and not 'addTest' (if you
> pass a class as parameter), iirc.

[To the original questioner, and not to Vladimir]

The correct way to solve this problem is to read the JavaDoc that comes
with JUnit.

Take care.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
